title: Cody Simpson has actually been crushing on Miley Cyrus for a long time
text:
I knew I loved you before I met you (Picture: Getty Images)

Miley Cyrus’s budding romance with Australian singer Cody Simpson has had people talking but it turns out maybe the person most shocked is Cody himself.

The 22-year-old may be Miley’s ‘type’ but Cody has had the Wrecking ball hitmaker in his sights for quite some time.

Over the years in interviews the Perfect singer has confessed that Miley was his ‘childhood celebrity crush’ and ‘will be, forever, the most dateable Disney star.’

He also admitted he ‘knew all the words to her songs’ and ‘was not ashamed about it at all’.

Aww sweetie.

Before he even met the pop singer he said that ‘Miley Cyrus seems like a pretty fun girl to kick it with hey’.

Cody Simpson talking about Miley over the years is so cute pic.twitter.com/C6Zt5XZUt7 — Smiley (@iadoremileys) October 6, 2019

‘Miley’s becoming a great mate,’ he said as their friendship developed. ‘She’s definitely at heart, a very sweet, normal girl.’

Cody even shared an anecdote about when ‘cool chick’ Miley brought him out pizza cakes and sang on his birthday.

Miley Cyrus made headlines when she was photographed making out with Cody after splitting with reality TV star Kaitlynn Carter after a whirlwind romance.

The two have since been less than shy about posting cute couple content to their socials, with Cody calling Miley ‘baby’ and sharing a video serenading her with some Elvis.

Cody shared a black and white snap of himself kissing Miley, after she made him breakfast before a swimming race he was competing it (Picture: Instagram)

Miley has come out in defence of the relationship, slamming haters who slut-shamed her for moving on too fast and sharing a public pash.

She reposted the footage of her and Cody puckering up on their date and commented: ‘Can a girl not get a f**king acai bowl and a morning make-out session in peace?’

She later shared a statement admitting she finds it frustrating dating people while in the public eye.

‘I know the public feels invested in my past relationship because they felt like they saw it thru from the beginning,’ she began. ‘I think that’s why people have always felt so entitled over my life and how I live it because they’ve watched me grow up.’

‘But I am grown now and make choices as an adult know the truth/details/reality,’ she added.

‘Get used to me dating – this is where I am at!’ she concluded.
